fields.summary: Fix kill command behavior under some Linux distributions.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
HADOOP-13434 inadvertently undid the fix made in HADOOP-12441.

The use of the bash builtin for kill was intentional, so let's restore that behavior.
fields.summary: Shell#getSignalKillCommand should use the bash builtin on Linux

comments.body:
cc [~vinodkv], [~leftnoteasy].

I'll post a patch shortly.

This message was automatically generated.

I have verified that this patch returns the original intent and adds the quoting of the pid.
+1

Thank you again Larry. I've committed this for 2.8.0.

No fix is necessary on 2.7.x.

By the way I addressed the remaining two checkstyle indentation warnings on commit (checkstyle seems to want a different convention than we use in Hadoop). The whitespace warnings looked spurious too.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10216 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10216/])
HADOOP-13467. Shell#getSignalKillCommand should use the bash builtin on (arp: rev b8ca84ac99d2cb2bfe43930eb9b178ee010e4812)
* hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/util/Shell.java
* hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/util/TestShell.java
